alert.note: Alert for Aguas Buenas; Caguas; Cidra; Gurabo; San Lorenzo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 5:51PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Aguas Buenas, Caguas, Cidra, Gurabo and San Lorenzo. * WHEN...Until 645 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 451 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caguas, Aguas Buenas, San Lorenzo, Gurabo, Cidra, Bairoa, Santa Clara, Celada, Jagual, Sumidero, Parcelas Nuevas, Parcelas La Milagrosa and Parcelas La Milagr. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Aguas Buenas; Caguas; Cidra; Gurabo; San Lorenzo
